definition: cangue (wooden collar like stocks used to restrain and punish criminals in China)

sentences.english: The humiliating grip of corruption and tyranny is being pried open.
sentences.chinese: 腐敗和暴政的恥辱枷鎖已被打開。

sentences.english: Canted yoke design provides high start torque.
sentences.chinese: 傾斜枷鎖開始設計提供高扭矩。

sentences.english: When tears slip the destiny chains, I deeply comfirm the unemotional washing-away.
sentences.chinese: 當淚水滑過命運枷鎖，我深信這是無感情的宣泄。
他們被套上了婚姻的枷鎖。

sentences.english: Let the constraints , set you free.
sentences.chinese: 讓束縛脫開枷鎖，釋放創意。

sentences.english: Spirits cabined and confined by winter expanded like matted cotton wadding fluffed out again.
sentences.chinese: 被冬天枷鎖了的靈魂，和被束掩的棉花一樣舒展開來。

sentences.english: To forgive others is to free you from the disabling chains of unforgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 原諒他人也是使你自己從不原諒的枷鎖中得到解放。

sentences.english: Their heritage from generation to generation is the belled yoke and the lash.''
sentences.chinese: 它們一代代的命運就是套上枷鎖，接受鞭撻。

sentences.english: They finally rise up and burst their fetters.
sentences.chinese: 他們最後挺身而起，掙開枷鎖。

sentences.english: They were bound up in fetters of conventionalism.
sentences.chinese: 他們被因襲主義的枷鎖所束縛。

sentences.english: Which snaps in twain the shackles that bind you to the world.
sentences.chinese: 突然間地把將你束縛在世上的枷鎖折成兩半。

sentences.english: People clamored to be free of its yoke.
sentences.chinese: 人們嚷嚷着要求解開枷鎖。

sentences.english: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
sentences.chinese: 人是生而自由的，卻又無往不在枷鎖之中。

sentences.english: The people rose, casting off the chains of unjust rule.
sentences.chinese: 人民擺脫了暴政的枷鎖，站起來了。

definition: to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to worry about/to be concerned about
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
